Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearances as to Angel A. Mendez-Gonzalez (2), Carlos L. Carrero-Ramos (4), Ana Hernandez- Valentin (10), Ruben Alexis Ruiz- Vazquez (18), Johanna Irizarry- Rodriguez (19) and Oniel J. Ruiz-Torres (21) were held on 12/17/2013. Defendants were provided with copies of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendants will be represented by CJA counsel. Arraignment/Detention Hearings are set for 12/20/2013 at 2:00 PM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. Defendants ordered temporarily  detained pending further proceedings. (USPO Carolina Aparicio, Interpreter Mary Jo Smith) (Hearing was held at 12:36-12:55 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 12/17/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearances as to Nestor Class-Hernandez (1), Amaury Balbino-Nazario (3), Francis H. Roman-Tavares (8), Isoel Cuevas-Medina (11), Jorge Israel Bonilla-Irizarry (13) and Joshua Class-Hernandez (15) were held on 12/17/2013. Defts were provided with copies of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defts, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant 3 will be represented by the FPD's office. Defts 1, 8, 11, 13 & 15 shall be represented by CJA counsel. In the interest of justice & judicial economy, deft 8 shall be directly appointed Atty Richard Dansoh to represent him. Mr. Dansoh was already appointed represent him in CR. 13-284 (GAG). Arraignment/Bail Hearings are set for 12/31/2013 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. Defendants ordered temporarily detained pending further proceedings. (USPO Carolina Aparicio, Interpreter Mary Jo Smith) (Hearing was held at 12:36-12:55 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 12/17/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Carlos L. Carrero-Ramos (4) were held on 12/20/2013. Present: AUSA Dennise Longo & Atty Miguel Rodriguez. Dft is UC. Deft has retained Atty Miguel Rodriguez to represent him. Atty Francisco Adams is granted leave to withdraw. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon for trial setting. The govt moved for detention. Defense counsel was heard as to bail. The Court granted the govt's motion for detention. Deft to remain detained pending further proceedings. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 2:00 p.m., held at 3:10-3:26 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 12/30/2013)
NOTICE OF ATTORNEY APPEARANCE: Miguel A. Rodriguez-Robles appearing for Carlos L. Carrero-Ramos (4). (mc) (Entered: 12/30/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Ruben Alexis Ruiz- Vazquez (18) were held on 12/20/2013. Present: AUSA Dennise Longo & Atty Joseph Boucher. Dft is OB. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The govt has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon for trial setting. The govt moved for detention. Defense counsel was heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $5,000.00 to be secured by cash or real property. Bonding company shall be allowed. Conditions of release as recommended by PTS to include: drug testing/drug treatment and curfew as directed by the USPO. Order to issue once the secured portion of the bail has been posted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearing called but not held on 1/17/2014. AUSA Dennise Longo and defense counsel Ramon Gonzalez were present. During the colloquy at the Arraignment, defendant expressed that, although counsel advised him of his charges in the indictment at MDC, he does not recall that meeting since he had two epileptic attacks that morning. Understanding that additional time is warranted, the Court reset both hearings. The parties had no objection. Arraignment/Bail Hearings RESET for 1/21/2014 02:00 PM in Courtroom 8 before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 10:14. Hearing ended at 10:21. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 01/17/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Josue Class-Hernandez (17) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 held on 1/21/2014. AUSA Dennise Longo and defense counsel Ramon M. Gonzalez were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel proffered that, due to defendant's degenerative disease, he can not walk and requested that bond be set. Defendant's mother-in-law is willing have him in her house. The Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation, appears in a video selling a firearm. Based on the weight of the evidence and being a presumption case, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. If after defense counsel reviews the discovery, counsel may reopen the matter of bail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:26. Hearing ended at 02:37. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (br) (Entered: 01/21/2014)

Present SAUSA Myriam Fernandez, Atty. Artemio Rivera and PO Joseline Perez. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: DeNovo Hearing as to Luis Fosse-Morales (5) held on 8/14/2014. Present: AUSA Denisse Longo and defense counsel Rafael Castro-Lang. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Emmanuel Bravo also present. Defense proceeds by proffer. States that defendant's mother and brother can be his third party custodians and is willing to be  placed on EMD. Defendant is in dire need to receive medical treatment. Government requests that if bail is granted that third party custodian(s) be appointed. Court sets bail as follows: $40,000 cash or secured, defendant's mother and brother are appointed as his third party custodians, EMD, home detention-curfew to be fixed by the USPO, urinalysis, drug rehabilitation treatment program and be in medical treatment, remain employed and/or be enrolled in an educational program. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:00 p.m. Hearing held at 1:45 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:15 p.m. Interpreter Rafael Castro-Lang. (sr) (Entered: 08/14/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Pretrial Conference as to Nestor Class-Hernandez (1), Angel A. Agron-Gonzalez (2), Ovidio Datiz-Rodriguez (7), Francis H. Roman-Tavares (8), Wilmy Pacheco-Urena (12), Jorge Israel Bonilla-Irizarry (13), Joshua Class-Hernandez (15), Annette Gaya-Concepcion (24) held on 9/8/2014. Present: AUSAs Denisse Longo and Luke Cass. Defense attorneys Jorge Vega, Thomas Lincoln, Laura Maldonado, Richard Dansoh, Mariangela Tirado, Jason Gonzalez and Jedrick Burgos are present, attorney Juan Masini, was excused. Based on the information provided by the Government, attorneys for defendants 1, 2 & 15 request their clients be brought in and advised of Government's intent to file the information to establish prior conviction. Court grants request and hearing will be held today at 1:30 p.m. as well as hearings to address attorney-client issues regarding defendants 1-2. Attorney Maldonado informs that she will meet again with the Government so they can provide any additional testimonial evidence, and requests an extension of the COP deadline. Request is Granted and plea cut-off date is due by 9/10/2014. By no later than today, the Government is to file their response to motion filed at DE 412. Court notes that attorney Tirado is still on trial in CR. 09-0165 (CCC). However, as informed by counsel, she will meet with client to ascertain if they will proceed to trial. Motion to consolidate filed at DE 507, as to defendant #8 is Granted, subject to the approval of Judge Gelpi. Attorney Burgos informs his client will plead out. There are no further issues brought forth by the defense. At the request of attorney Tirado, her client will be brought to Court and the Government will provide a proffer of the evidence to be presented at trial. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:15 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:50 a.m. (sr) (Entered: 09/09/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Nestor Class-Hernandez (1) held on 9/8/2014 re 490 MOTION for Hearing on Defendant's Request for New Counsel and 475 MOTION to Appoint Counsel. Present: AUSAs Dennise Longo and Luke Cass and defense counsel Jorge Vega-Pacheco. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Issues brought forth in the aforementioned motions were discussed. The defendant clarified he had no objection to remain with counsel. He's seeking a better plea offer from the Government. Court notes that it does not intervene in plea negotiations, therefore, being there no basis to support a substitution of counsel, attorney Jorge Vega is to remain as counsel for record. Plea deadline is due 9/10/2014. Jury Trial remains set for 9/22/2014. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 2:30 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:45 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sr) (Entered: 09/09/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Attorney Appointment Hearing as to Angel A. Agron-Gonzalez (2) held on 9/8/2014. Present: AUSAs Dennise Longo and Luke Cass. Defense counsel Thomas Lincoln also present. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Issues brought forth by counsel regarding his continued representation of defendant were addressed. Finding there's no basis for substitution of counsel, attorney Thomas Lincoln will remain as attorney of record. Plea deadline due by 9/10/2014 and Jury Trial remains set for 9/22/2014. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 2:45 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:00 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sr) (Entered: 09/09/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Defendants Meeting as to Nestor Class-Hernandez (1), Angel A. Agron-Gonzalez (2), Wilmy Pacheco-Urena (12), Joshua Class-Hernandez (15) held on 9/8/2014. Present: AUSA Dennise Longo and Luke Cass. Defense attorneys Jorge Vega, Thomas Lincoln, Mariangela Tirado and Jason Gonzalez. Attorney Lara Castro also present. Defendants assisted by Court Interpreter. Government informs that the Information to establish prior conviction in accordance with Title 21 USC  851 will be filed as to defendants 1, 2, 7 and 15. Court notes that defendants 1, 2 and 15 are present at the request of defense attorneys and Government's intent is so advised to them in open court and the imprisonment term they are exposed to should they be found guilty at trial. Government also proffers the evidence to be presented at trial as to each defendant, including defendant #12 who is also present in court. Court addresses attorney Castro's concern (her client will be entering a plea of guilty), and at time of sentencing the applicable law will be applied. Plea deadline due on 9/10/2014 at close of business day and for the third point for acceptance of responsibility to be considered. Government is to disclose Jencks and Giglio Material by 9/10/2014. Attorney Thomas Lincoln is authorized to review the PTS Report of his client. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:00 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:30 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sr) (Entered: 09/09/2014)

COPY of Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi in Cr. 12- 256 (GAG): Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi: Further Pretrial Conference as to Dante Tagliaventi (1), Hector Miranda-Royjas (2), Francis Roman-Tavares (4), James Fonseca-Rivera (5), Samuel Ortiz-Ojeda (6) held on 10/27/2014: AUSA Timothy Henwood, Juan A. Albino, Todd M. Merer, Victor P. Miranda-Corrada, and Miguel Oppenheimer for Ramon M. Gonzalez were present. The United States informed the status of the pending defendants in this case. In regards co- defendants Tagliaventi (1), and Fonseca Rivera (5), the United States provided today the discovery to counsel Albino. In regards co-defendant Miranda-Torres (2) parties in principle reached an agreement, and motion for change of plea shall be filed within the next ten (10) days. In regards co-defendant Roman-Tavares (4), this case was consolidated with Cr. 13-888-08, and 13-284-01 before Judge Gelpi for plea and sentencing purposes. The United States informed that parties are working to reach an agreement to disposed the three (3) cases. In regards co-defendant Ortiz-Ojeda (6) parties are under plea negotiations. The Court set a final pretrial conference for December 2, 2014 at 9:00 a.m. On this date, the Court will set jury trial. In regards co- defendants Tagliaventi (1), and Fonseca Rivera (5), counsel Albino will inform the Court if more time is required considering that discovery was provided today. The Court made a finding that the Speedy Trial shall remain tolled in the best interest of justice which outweighs the best interest of the public and the defendants under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 3161(h)(7)(A) until the next conference in order for the parties to finalize plea negotiations. No objection by the defense. Final Pretrial Conference set for December 2, 2014 at 9:00 AM. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:41.Hearing ended at 09:44. (om) (Entered: 10/27/2014)

ORDER re 795 Motion to Continue and Motion Requesting Order as to Ovidio Datiz- Rodriguez (7): DENIED as to both requests. Defendant has had more than sufficient time since his arrest to take care of these personal matters. He was arrested on March 7,

and remained at MDC Guaynabo until May 16, 2014, when he was transferred to an institution in the continental United States. He was returned to MDC Guaynabo on July 1, 2014 and remained there until January 22, 2015 when he was again transferred stateside. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing Hearing called as to Henry Rodriguez-Lopez (6) on 7/2/2015. Present: AUSA John Andre Matthews, II and defense counsel Rosa Bonini. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. UPSO Carmen Villeta also present. Defense counsel objects that her client was placed in a CHC of III due to the fact that the state case is relevant conduct. Upon inquiry of the Court, she fails to provide any supporting documents to that effect. Government's counsel, who was recently assigned to the case, is unaware and cannot provide any further information. Defense counsel then waives her objection. The Court finds that additional time is necessary to verify the initial information proffered by the defense. Therefore. the Court will not sentence the defendant today. Sentencing Hearing set to continue on 7/8/2015 at 2:30 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. No time for today is to be compensated under CJA funds.(Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:45 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:05 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescion1. (sr) (Entered: 07/06/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 7/8/2015 for Henry Rodriguez-Lopez (6). Present: AUSA John Andre Matthews, II and defense counsel Rosa Bonini. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Defense counsel informs that she verified and the prior csae cannot be considered relevant conduct, however, it was her understanding that the imprisonment term would run concurrent. Government position is that points accrue for that conduct. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1, IMPR: Twenty-seven (27) months, as to Count 1 in CR. 13-0888-06 (ADC), to be served concurrently with the 27 months imposed as to Count 3 in CR. 13-0158-01 (ADC) and consecutively to the 60 months imposed as to Count 4 in CR. 13-0158-01 (ADC),for a total imprisonment term of eight-seven (87) months. SRT of Ten (10) years as to Count 1 in CR. 13-888-06 (ADC) and 5 years as to Count 3 and 3 years as to Count 4, all to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00. Count(s) 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, Dismissed. Government is to corroborate the information provided by the defendant and address the defendant's concern regarding the matter brought forth and a response is to be provided by tomorrow. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:05 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:15 p.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) Modified on 7/17/2015 to add text(ov). (Entered: 07/14/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Sentencing held on 7/21/2015 for Jorge Israel Bonilla-Irizarry (13). Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez and defense counsel Jedrick Burgos. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. PSR to be amended accordingly to the rulings made by the Court. Sentencing Memo filed at DE 1047 is Noted. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Government states that pursuant to the parties' plea negotiations, they will not seek a firearms enhancement. Court notes enhancement will not be applied. Defendant's allocution heard. Parties agree, that as stated by the Court, the defendant's arrest date is 12/17/2013. Defense then moves that the state sentence be considered relevant conduct, pursuant to Section 5G1.3 b(2) and sentence be imposed concurrently. USPO Renee Perez provides the Court with a copy of the state sentence, and the State Judge specifically ordered the imprisonment term to be served consecutively to any other sentence. Brief recess. Court then made findings that Section 5G1.3 b(2) is not applicable and the defendant is not entitled to a concurrent sentence, there is no undischarged term of imprisonment. Count(s) 1, IMPR: Eighty Seven(87) months. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00. Forfeiture imposed.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 3:15 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:55 p.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) Modified on 7/22/2015 to add text (ov). (Entered: 07/22/2015)

JUDGMENT as to Jorge Israel Bonilla-Irizarry (13), Count(s) 1, IMPR: Eighty-seven (87) months. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00. Forfeiture imposed.;  Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 7/21/2015.(sr) (Entered: 07/22/2015)

ORDER as to Jorge Israel Bonilla-Irizarry (13) re 1062 Motion for Reconsideration, Motion to Amend/Correct, Motion to Clarify. In light of the new evidence submitted by defendantspecifically, the Amended Judgment, dated August 4, 2015 (the same date that the Notice of Appeal was filed, and thus, not available at sentencing)the Court is inclined to reconsider the sentence imposed. In order to do so, though, the Court requires the return of the record from the First Circuit. Therefore, the Court hereby requests the return of the record from the First Circuit Court of Appeals, so that this Court may complete the same. The Clerk is ORDERED to forward a copy of this Order to the First Circuit Court of Appeals forthwith. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 9/10/2015.(wm) (Entered: 09/10/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 9/30/2015 for Mark Anthony Irizarry-Rivera (16). Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez and defense attorneys Jose Gaztambide and Luis Rivera. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Elisa Abruna also present. Defense is aware of the pro-se motions filed by defendant at Docket Entries 1033, 1133 and 1134. However, it is  clarified that the defendant filed them to preserve his right on the record for appeal purposes. Nonetheless, the Court notes that the request to withdraw his plea of guilty was already ruled upon by the Court, see DE 784 and will proceed to sentencing, findings on the record. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos Claudio-Aquino (22) held on 8/20/2019. AFPD Laura Soto was present. The defendant was present in court, under custody and assisted by the certified court interpreter. A copy of ECF No. 1309 was provided to the defendant. He was advised of the SRT violations and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 9/3/2019 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 10.) Hearing held at 10:59. Hearing ended at 11:04. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (jjr) (Entered: 08/20/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Carlos Claudio-Aquino (22) held on 9/30/2019. AUSA Marc Chattah, AFPD Sulay Rios and USPO Olivia Beltran were present. Defendant was present in court, under custody and assisted by the certified court interpreter. The government called USPO Olivia Beltran to the witness stand and sworn testimony was heard. Direct and cross examination was conducted. The government called PRPD Agent Yamira Cruz-Olivo to the witness stand and sworn testimony was  heard. Direct and cross examination was conducted. After having heard the witnesses and the parties, the Court found probable cause as to all the allegations at ECF No. 1309 , except for the excessive use of alcohol portion regarding the violation of standard condition No. 7. The case was referred to Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon for the scheduling of a Final Revocation Hearing. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 10.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 09:59. Hearing ended at 04:02. Interpreter Olga Uribe and Virginia Santamaria. (jjr) (Entered: 10/02/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Wilson Quintana-Hernandez (14) held on 11/20/2019. AUSA Jose Contreras, defense counsel Hector Dauhajre and USPO Leslie Aponte were present. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the certified court interpreter. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6. Unless there is an order or directive from the presiding US District Judge indicating otherwise, the government shall have 7 days to produce discovery and the defense 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado Colon for further proceedings. As to Bail, defense counsel informed they have nothing to offer but reserved defendant's right to re-open the Bail Hearing. The government moved for detention. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending trial. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 10.) Hearing set for 11:00. Hearing held at 11:03. Hearing ended at 11:07. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Status Conference as to Wilson Quintana-Hernandez (14) held on 3/4/2020. Present: AUSA Marc Chattah and defense counsel Hector Dauhajre. Government informed discovery was provided, proffer session took place last week and plea negotiations remain ongoing. Government clarified that pursuant to the new US Attorneys' Office policy a sole plea offer will be extended to the defense. No lower plea offers will be tendered. Therefore, if the same is rejected and defendant decides to later enter a plea of guilty, it will be for a higher exposure. No plea counter-offers can be considered pursuant to the new policy. Therefore, Government is encouraging that plea negotiations are exhausted informally before extending the sole plea offer. Defense requested 45 days to obtain necessary documents to submit a mitigation package to the Government and conclude negotiations. Request Granted. Plea Cut-Off Deadline due by 4/24/2020. Pretrial Conference set for 4/24/2020 at 1:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Trial to be set. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson-Ware.) Hearing set for 1:00 p.m. Hearing held at 1:15 p.m. Hearing ended at 1:20 p.m. (sr) (Entered: 03/04/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Carlos Claudio-Aquino (22) held on 6/10/2020 by VTC. Present: AUSA Marc Chattah and AFPD Sulay Rios. Defendant  present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Olivia Beltran also present. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record. The interpreter is acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at Bayamon-705 and we have a clear view of him on screen. Defense did not contest the violations, as so informed by the USPO. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard, on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. SRT revoked and an imprisonment term of 12 months was imposed. SRT of 7 years. Defense moved for reconsideration and requested time served. Reconsideration Granted and an imprisonment term of time served was imposed and SRT of 7 years remains in place. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 1:25 p.m. Hearing ended at 1:40 p.m.Interpreter Olga Uribe/Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 06/10/2020)

ORDER REFERRING MOTION To Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin as to Wilson Quintana-Hernandez (14) re 1367 MOTION for change of plea filed by Wilson Quintana-Hernandez. Given the exigent circumstances generated by the COVID-19 Pandemic, and while considering the related and relevant dispositions within the MDC- Guaynabo and USMs protocols and consistent with the Order issued by Chief Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi pursuant to the Cares Act (See 20-mc-088), the Court finds that the only viable mechanism in which it may currently conduct a change of plea hearing is by Video Conference. This will ensure public health and safety and also afford for the proceedings to be conducted without further delay. The mechanisms herein implemented are in the best interests of justice and the parties. Therefore, the Motion for Change of Plea is referred to Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin for setting of Rule 11 Hearing and submission of Report and Recommendation. Hearing shall be set in accordance to the calendar availability of the Magistrate Judge. The Further Status Conference set for today, 7/22/2020 before the undersigned, is HEREBY VACATED. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 7/22/2020.(sr) (Entered: 07/22/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Wilson Quintana-Hernandez (14) held on 1/4/2021 via Video Tele-Conference (VTC). Present were AUSA Marc S. Chattah and Atty. Hector J. Dauhajre-Rodriguez. The defendant was U/C and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. The defendant also consented to proceed before a US Magistrate Judge. The defendant was found competent to plead. He was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, the consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. AUSA Chattah stated that there was an error on the Plea Agreement, but after consulting with defense counsel he withdrew the statement and informed that the Plea Agreement was correct. The Court noted the statement. Having heard the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation so that the plea of guilty as to Count One of the Indictment be accepted. PSI Report is ordered. The defendant will remain detained. Sentencing Hearing will be set by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Robin Dispenzieri / ZoomGov Recording.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 10:20. Hearing ended at 10:50. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (ram) (Entered: 01/04/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 3/30/2021 for Wilson Quintana-Hernandez (14) by VTC. Present: AUSA Mare Chattah and defense counsel Hector Dauhajre. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Carmen Villeta also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government stood by its sentence recommendation of 108 months.
